PageTitle: display mpls te p2mp tunnel path
FuncDef: The display mpls te p2mp tunnel path command displays path attributes of the P2MP TE tunnel.
CLIs: display mpls te p2mp tunnel path [ [ tunnel-name ] tunnel-name ] [ lsp-id <ingress-id> <session-id> <p2mp-id> lsp-id [ s2l-destination <leaf> ] ]
display mpls te p2mp tunnel path fast-reroute { local-protection-available | local-protection-inuse }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the P2MP TE tunnel name.
The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The tunnel name must be the same as that in the configuration file, case-sensitive and spaces not supported. For example, if a configuration file specifies the tunnel interface "interface Tunnel10", the tunnel-name parameter must specify the P2MP TE tunnel as "Tunnel10". Both "Tunnel10" and "Tunnel 10" are incorrect.

Specifies an LSP ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

Specifies the ingress LSR ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies a session ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

Indicates the P2MP ID.
The value is a hexadecimal number ranging from 0 to FFFFFFFF.

Specifies the IP address of a leaf node.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Indicates that the local protection of fast reroute (FRR) is available.
-

Indicates that the local protection of fast reroute is in use.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display mpls te p2mp tunnel path
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After a P2MP RSVP-TE tunnel is established, the display mpls te p2mp tunnel path can be run to display path attributes of a specific or all P2MP TE LSPs.
If a P2MP TE tunnel is established over an explicit path, information about the path of the established P2MP RSVP-TE tunnel is displayed.If a P2MP TE tunnel is established by calculating the shortest path, information about the actual path of the P2MP RSVP-TE tunnel is displayed. Constraint shortest path first (CSPF) is used to calculate the shortest path that originates from the ingress and is destined for a leaf node.

Prerequisites
The mpls te record-route command must be configured before the path attributes are recorded and displayed.
